intro: Cynodon affinis, commonly known as silvergrass, is a perennial grass species native to Africa. It is characterized by its fine, silver-colored blades and tufted growth habit, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It is adapted to dry conditions and can tolerate moderate grazing. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping and erosion control.
